Authors:
K. Agretious Thomas, Meinhard M. Moser, P. Manimohan,
Ursula Peintner
Title:
Anamika, a new mycorrhizal genus of Cortinariaceae from India
and its phylogenetic position based on ITS and LSU sequences.
Abstract:
Anamika gen. nov. is described from Southern India with
one species, A. indica. The genus is characterised by spores with a
strongly cavernous type of ornamentation due to cavernae in the
epitunica (perispor), and the possession of cheilo-, pleuro- and
caulocystidia. It seems to be associated with Hopea species
(Dipterocarpaceae). Molecular data suggest a close relationship to
Hebeloma and Naucoria, but indicate that it represents an independent
line of evolution.
